website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for households with multiple gardeners – these cute floral gardening gloves come in a 3 pack of different colors.
pros: The soft jersey material is extremely comfortable yet doesn't tear easily
PVC dots offer extra grip for pulling weeds
Users appreciate the fact they're machine washable
cons: Don't offer much protection so only useful for lighter tasks, such as weeding and planting

customer_reviews.title: LATEX FREE
customer_reviews.text: It's very hard to find gloves that are latex free except for nitrile... Which isn't a good gardening glove. Love these so far. Cotton will not prevent leakage if you get muddy or wet though.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are great to use pudding around the yard or whatever you ...
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great to use pudding around the yard or whatever you need to do wearing a lighter fabric glove. I usually rinse them good with a waterhose to remove heavy soil then toss them in the washer. If they do tear you can just sew up the hole, no problem. They are tuff enough and last a long, long time if not overused or used in super hard work. Great garden gloves and soft. Highly reccomend. I like to keep a couple pairs in our RV for handling wood or whatever but not to handle anything hot like frying pans. They are lightweight. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Totally useless
customer_reviews.text: Awful, awful, awful!! Stripped them off with frustration after ten minutes as I realized that every cocktail, every sticker, every thorn permeated this pretty but THIN fabric. They are totally useless.........can't think for a use for them!!!
customer_reviews.author: mssusana

customer_reviews.title: Warm and cute - a bit small for me
customer_reviews.text: I like these cheerful gloves. I am not sure if I want to wear them in summer, because the inside is pretty toasty, but great for fall/winter. I want to mention that I had to stitch a small hole between the wrist part and the main part - I wish if they had inspected them better. However, it was not so bad. They are a tiny bit too small for me, but I can wear them (my middle finger measures 3 inches/8 cm).
customer_reviews.author: fucchi_y

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought them to replace the same type of glove. They are comfortable and I like them a lot, but the work I needed them for was not a great match. The weeding I was doing had a lot of pricklies and the cloth couldn't prevent my hands getting stabbed. They also got just filthy. I still like them, just for other types of garden work, like mowing, raking, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Lilenfeld

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: These are the best all purpose gloves - comfortable, washable, knit cuffs and fit perfectly (I have smaller hands.) They may not be the most sturdy but work well for gardening, yard work, and light work that doesn't require leather gloves. The little bumps are also helpful for a good grip. I will definitely order these again and the price was very good.
customer_reviews.author: Leighanne

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality gloves
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with these gloves. As soon as I opened them I seen they were defective. All 3 pair had holes and seems unraveling. Fingers in gloves are very short. These are terrible! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Handy as a set
customer_reviews.text: When you do a lot of gardening, you go through a lot of gardening gloves. Which is why a 3 pack of these gloves comes in handy. They do the trick, keep your hands clean and keep wet pots from slipping through your fingers. All you have to do is wash them then hang them to dry. Once the first pair wears out, I'll just move onto the next pair. So it's a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: ohoy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GLOVES
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent gloves. I have large hands for a woman and was concerned if they would fit but they fit great. They are also sturdy, I have done all my planting work now in my vegetable garden and my gloves do not show excess wear (no tears or holes, etc). I ordered second set to have on hand. One pair of the gloves would make a great gift for your gardening friends.
customer_reviews.author: Zee in CA

customer_reviews.title: Colorful Garden Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for quarantine and because I live in a rural area. Prior garden gloves fell apart after one wash. So far so good with these. They fit me well but I do have petite hands so not sure if they would be great for folks with large hands. Beautiful colors. Happy with purchase on personal level.
customer_reviews.author: Katein theCity

customer_reviews.title: Great little washable gloves
customer_reviews.text: These comfy little cloth gloves arrived early and were packaged in minimal recyclable materials. My old ones were so old and finally wore out after perhaps five years. They are good for easy weed pulling, protecting my hands from shovel and rake blisters and general thorn free uses. Mine are a medium size...a little loose until washed and they stretch out by the time they need to be washed again. I don't like gloves that are hard or difficult to get on over tender hands. Not for use with thorny growth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves if you don’t have thorny bushes or weeds
customer_reviews.text: I really like that you can get a set of three in this pack. I tend to lose things so it’s helped to have spares. If you do more gentle work like digging or raking leaves I’d say these are just fine. I’ve washed them and they don’t fall apart. They seem pretty nice for the price. My yard had thorny brambles and weeds so I had to upgrade to something a bit more sturdy for the sake of my hands. Not sorry I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Mentzer

customer_reviews.title: Developed a hole after less than an hour of light use.
customer_reviews.text: What I like about these gloves: The designs are pretty. There are three pairs. The grip is good. The fit is ok for a one-size-fits-all glove (I'm a 5' 8" woman with small-ish hands). The colors withstand washing, even with hot water. My nails are adequately protected from breakage. What I don't like: One pair developed a hole at the tip of the middle finger, dominant hand after less than an hour of repotting plants. They aren't water-resistant in the least; the cotton absorbs moisture and they readily hold dampness. Soil also manages to get through the weave of the fabric and under my nails.
customer_reviews.author: Q Kallisti

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: These did not last long. A couple uses in the garden resulted in dirt filling the fingertips and holes forming. Maybe if you are only using them while using hand tools they will last longer, but I was using my hands to pull weeds and one pair lasted maybe 24hrs.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent garden gloves
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why I waited so long to replace my old worn garden gloves. These are perfect size, fit and very attractive colours. I have medium size hands. Love that they come in a three pack, are well made, soft material and ribbing on the palm side for grabbing. I live in Florida and can work outside for most months. These are a welcome addition to making my chores easier. Haven’t washed yet, but will test that soon. Probably won’t over dry them.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good...
customer_reviews.text: So, these are the same gloves I picked up at the dollar store, which makes the price close to the same. They are breathable, unlike the latex/rubber-type versions. However, the durability isn’t the same as the more expensive canvas-type gloves from the big stores. All in all, I’ll continue to buy these, especially since I tend to leave gloves outside or misplace them altogether!
customer_reviews.author: Kamy

customer_reviews.title: Love these cotton gloves with the pebble palm!!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for! Hard to find in stores, so I was thrilled to get 3 pairs! I would give it 5 stars, but the blue pair (3 different colors come in the order) came with 2 left hands and I was unable to contact the seller about it without initiating a return and did not want to return the whole order.....I would order again as I think it was just an oversight.....will buy again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but for small hands
customer_reviews.text: These will do. I haven't used them in the dirt yet, but I am glad I have 3 pairs because I always get holes in my garden gloves. They are on the thinner side and may run small for some. I have tiny hands and they fit me perfect.
customer_reviews.author: RugbYogi

customer_reviews.title: Colorful & multi-purpose
customer_reviews.text: As some have pointed out, these are a little on the thin side. But they fit well, go on easily and let my fingers move when using them doing a variety of tasks outside or in the garage. I like having them as they cut down on my blisters, nicks and scratches, Plus you get three pairs, so you can always toss them in the washer. They look great.
customer_reviews.author: KLouthan

customer_reviews.title: Light duty, comfy garden gloves.
customer_reviews.text: These are too light duty to wear even for working with cucumbers or radishes - you'll get pricked right through the glove. Also, I dug my hand into a bag of dirt and ended up with dirt in my nails. But, for a light duty glove to pick berries, handle hoses, plant using a shovel, they're great. Inexpensive, fun colors and have held up thus far.
customer_reviews.author: iThinkYou'reFunny

customer_reviews.title: Good for dirt only, no protection from pricks
customer_reviews.text: These look nice and the fit is good and are comfortable. But they do not off any protection at all from anything that could poke thru! It's pretty much just for dirt gardening. I do not suggest pulling weeds or pruning anything that has something that could prick. Very painful and slows down the job. I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ann

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because of the price and variety in the gloves. I'd recommend buying longer gloves if you are buying these and working with soil. They aren't long enough to protect a little soil from getting in the gloves. Also, I order a medium and have medium sized hands but would have gotten a large for more space.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Best gardening gloves ever!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful in every way. I got these for my mom because she does a lot of gardening. These are her absolute favorite type of gloves. She has used many types over the years including more expensive gloves and leather gloves but she loves these the best. I have looked everywhere for these for years and finally found them on Amazon, thankfully! You have a happy mom and happy daughter now!
customer_reviews.author: I Heart Cats

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: One reviewer said the rose thorns went through. it is not that kind of gloves--get another kind if you want protection from thorns. I use it for potting, carrying stuff, hosing the plants, etc. and they are great. I am hoarding one pair and one pair is now very dirty, good for planting and dirt. Great price. Will buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: fruitjuicer1

customer_reviews.title: Just okay, wouldn’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: These fit awkwardly for me. I’ve worn them a lot for odd jobs around the house. Kind of annoyed fibers come out and have deposited in a stain/poly job I’m working on but obviously they aren’t specifically made for that. Rubber gloves are just hard to come by these days so they’ll suffice for what I need them for.
customer_reviews.author: Hj

customer_reviews.title: Cloth garden gloves - as expected
customer_reviews.text: These arrived intact and on time. Cute colors. There's not too much to say about them as they are just regular cloth garden gloves. Holding up as well as any others I've had in the past. Like having more than one pair so that I can wash them before they get too dirty and the dirt gets ground in.
customer_reviews.author: ladyt

customer_reviews.title: Great for yard work.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great for gardening and yard work. I've been using them since the Summer and they have been great at keeping my hands protected while working in the yard. They are nice and soft too. The bonus was that it was a three pack (at a great price) so I have enough gloves for all of the gardeners in the family!
customer_reviews.author: Lucia

customer_reviews.title: Only Lasted One Wearing!
customer_reviews.text: Used the gloves to plant my vegetable garden. fingers were full of holes after use. Used a second pair to plant my flower garden. Same result.
customer_reviews.author: melly

customer_reviews.title: 100  percent cotton is hard to find in women's gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are 100 percent cotton, they do not make your hands sweat!!! Here in the desert that is important, if you want a waterproof glove these are not for you unless you want to use these as a liner for another glove. I absolutely love these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Cocoa

customer_reviews.title: Great Price for Three Pairs
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've bought these gloves. The first time I purchased them was in the garden shop of a large national chain of a home improvement store. This time, I decided to look on amazon and saw this package of three pairs, for a similar price to what I paid for the one pair. I really like the gloves because they are comfortable and fit my hands well, not bulky. I wear them a lot as I do quite a bit of gardening; they last about one season. I will be back on amazon to order more when these ones wear out!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Keeping up with the Jones, in style!
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking gloves. When I get one pair dirty I can use another while the first is in the wash. Can’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: A Reader

customer_reviews.title: These garden gloves are very good
customer_reviews.text: I am a senior woman who has a large property to maintain alone and with osteoarthritis the other types of vinyl garden gloves were uncomfortable and made marks on my hands. These are fabulous. I ordered 2 sets now and they are good to be able to wash and just sit on a paper towel to dry. Very good pricing as always with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: MariaTia

customer_reviews.title: Not for extensive gardening
customer_reviews.text: Cute, but not meant for gardening over time. I used them twice and both times they became quite dirty and I could feel moisture coming through to my hands. My nails were also dirty after removing them. These would be ok for light yard work.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect forPotting Plants and Easy Gardening
customer_reviews.text: I have small hands and these fit very well. They are not snug but not oversized. I used them for mulching, light shrub trimming with sheers, picking up grass clippings, and potting plants. They are not waterproof and they do not protect your hands from thorns or prickly shrubs.
customer_reviews.author: SarahMonroe

customer_reviews.title: Great set of gloves
customer_reviews.text: I'm always losing my garden gloves so I was very pleased to find these. The price for 3 is very reasonable and they are very nice, seem to be good quality. I haven't used any of them yet but definitely will.
customer_reviews.author: Pb

customer_reviews.title: Very cute, good for gardens and cats!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! They are not heavy duty but for general gardening! Yanking some vines down, etc they are fine. Very cute, too! And the pebbles/textured palm means my cat loves them. Yes, they make great cat petters😄
customer_reviews.author: Elmtree01

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are perfectly okay outdoor gloves, a little small for my hands and rather likely to develop holes after a couple months but just fine for the price. I might even be wrong about their durability, but I'd buy them again at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Used these gloves twice and they have a hole. A complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: roo frasser

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: At under $8, here is a trio of garden gloves with very decent quality and pretty patterns. I am still using the blue pair, and so far, they have endured several weed pulling sessions in my yard. Before purchasing these garden gloves, I was using disposable latex gloves which would always rip or tear anytime I got nicked by a weed, or bush branch, etc. I'm impressed and beyond satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed with these
customer_reviews.text: The fabric was a loose weave which would not protect your hands from scratches and scrapes while working in the garden. This is the problem with ordering online, you cannot feel the density of the fabric online. I would not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't last long...
customer_reviews.text: They won't last long in my garden or while doing yardwork.
customer_reviews.author: Inez Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Bright Trio
customer_reviews.text: I've been working on my deck this summer and getting rid of a lot of junk. These gloves make it easier on my hands. They wash up nicely in the washing machine and I'm very happy with them. A good buy at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: britishmaid

customer_reviews.title: Yessss !!!! Buy them!
customer_reviews.text: Love them!! Came super fast and they are sooo cute! Colors are super bright and they are much thicker than I had expected like clearly they aren’t waterproof but they’re thick enough I was digging with them wet soil and the finger tips of two fingers started to feel a little moist after like 45 min. Definitely going to buy more!!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect yard gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These yard gloves are comfortable and easy to work while wearing. Their construction is strong and durable. My first New England fall, and gathering leaves was no problem. The inside of the gloves is soft as well! I'll be a repeat customer for these.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila A. Flanagan

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a huge fan. While they protect your hands from dirt, they don't really do much else. After one use, they were extremely dirty and stained a bit, even after washed. They are not protective at all, so any thistle like objects poke right through and are impossible to work with. They also do not make it any easier to grasp items that you are removing - they seem to slide just as easily as your hand would.
customer_reviews.author: BJMMSW

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: They’re fine and they’ll do the job. Not very think. I don’t think they’re “one size fits all” because I have small hands and the fingers are too short for me. One pair came with a hole in the cuff.
customer_reviews.author: Chussell

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves but 1 pair ripped within 2 weeks by fingertip
customer_reviews.text: I like these gloves and they are very useful in helping me put on my compression stocking due to cancer for Lympedema. But, 1 pair ripped within 2 weeks. Using 2nd pair now - third pair is still new. They are good and despite the one pair ripping in the finger I have still been able to use it for my needs. If you are using these gloves for other purposes, I don't know if they are strong enough and would last washing, etc. For my needs I definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: DavidD

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The material is comfortable and they fit my hands. I can pull weeds and work with tools easily. They’re not waterproof but my hands don’t sweat either when I’m working.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie3

customer_reviews.title: Light gardening only
customer_reviews.text: These are okay garden gloves. They were of little use to me because I had a lot of thistles to pull. For planting they will be fine. But thistles and rose thorns will poke through.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for flower gardening
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for light gardening. Easy to work in, breathable, and easy to wash! Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Yaiyai

customer_reviews.title: Won't last
customer_reviews.text: They are not for pulling weeds. (small weeds). I got holes in the fingers in no time..I'm 86 so can't be to rough on them...
customer_reviews.author: Margie S.

customer_reviews.title: not protective for pulling weeds
customer_reviews.text: I like the comfort. Can be used for planting in pots but not for weeding as the little wisps of grass weeds etc. stick right through the gloves. (ouch)
customer_reviews.author: Omana

customer_reviews.title: Cute and serviceable
customer_reviews.text: These are cute and serviceable but made of thin fabric. Price is good for three pairs. Probably won’t last more than one season per pair. Nice color and design.
customer_reviews.author: The Millers

customer_reviews.title: Not protect my hands
customer_reviews.text: Basically it’s not waterproof, it’s Ok, I can accepted. However, it’s can’t protect my hand when I crab some branches, my fingers got some blood spots. So angry for that!
customer_reviews.author: Vivi77

customer_reviews.title: Weird finger seams, make gripping hard
customer_reviews.text: I have small hands and the gloves fit well. I did find that the gloves are hard to pull weeds in. I end up breaking the roots because I can’t get a good grip. They’re ok. Wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are cotton and are very comfortable; much better than leather or water-proof synthetic which ...
customer_reviews.text: I go through garden gloves rapidly. I usually have 9 or 10 pairs in use at any give time. These gloves are cotton and are very comfortable; much better than leather or water-proof synthetic which causes hands to sweat too much. They get wet and muddy and machine launder well with other muddy clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Dautell

customer_reviews.title: Cute! Not thick.
customer_reviews.text: These are cute and great for easy gardening. They are not great for pulling weeds, or working with any kind of spikes/thorns. Very thin, and I am often stabbed right through them by any plant or weed with thorns. Great value though! The 3 pack was cute, I just need something more heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Corbett

customer_reviews.title: Ideal gloves for yard and garden care!
customer_reviews.text: These are properly cut-n-stitched gloves, dedicate left and right hands (no ambidextrous). Elastic wrist keeps them on even when wet and arms are resting at sides. Delicate, springtime pattern. Go through washer just fine. Haven't had any trouble with loose threads or fabric tears. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: pond-jumper

customer_reviews.title: OK gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are light gardening gloves. I thought that they might be enough to protect me from a thorny vine that I was taking off of a fence but these gloves did not do much. The green gloves also have dye transfer onto lighter colored things.
customer_reviews.author: Sreekanth

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good garden gloves for the price. Really like that they are a 3 pack. Pretty colors.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia B

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: The gloves lasted a few days but were used all day long digging, etc. For the price paid they were good gloves. A little on the short side meaning barely came to my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Janice A. Sokol

customer_reviews.title: floral 3 pack of gardening gloves
customer_reviews.text: I could not pass up this 3 pack of cotton gardening gloves. my mom loves the cotton ones and these were so cute so a win win. great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon b.

customer_reviews.title: Good gardening gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I have larger hands and these fit me ok! Just about right! They are just a little big on my 11 year old daughter but she can make do with them ok. The only downside is they do have a strange vinegar smell but it's not horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: in the colors i wanted--and the price was excellent!! thank you
customer_reviews.text: do you know i hunted in 5 stores looking for gardening gloves that were not the awful latex that makes your hands sweaty and clammy,before turning to amazon and finding exactly what i wanted, in the colors i wanted--and the price was excellent !! thank you,thank you
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Love my new gardening gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Very durable gloves. They fit my wrist well, so they keep my hands clean. I throw them in the wash when they get super dirty, and they come out good as new.
customer_reviews.author: amiller

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves but one pair was two rights
customer_reviews.text: Update - took off a star because one pair consisted of two right hand gloves. Amz wanted me to return the gloves for replacement but I had already used two of the pairs. *** Just got these and feel instant love. They are so soft and comfortBle. Look good too.
customer_reviews.author: Grandavia

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not great protection
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not made for yard work. Just a little protection for minor gardening. I bought these to protect my she while I weeded my yard. They did not protect my hands well. But they are ck For table
customer_reviews.author: Allysha C Benson

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have multiplies
customer_reviews.text: lightweight gloves which are nice; your hands don't sweat. just what I was looking for. Washes up easily but I air dry them.
customer_reviews.author: Bonanza Seller

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised...
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried that these would not fit. I have a small hand and these are just fine-comfortable and seem well made
customer_reviews.author: Mydogsmom

customer_reviews.title: Loose and small at the same time
customer_reviews.text: The glove is a bit small in terms of length for fingers and palms. Width wise, it is pretty roomy. It feels weird on.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Great for minor yard work.
customer_reviews.text: Fits Ok! But thumb is a little tight. Soft and comfortable. I do Florida light retired person yard work. Meaning NOT MUCH.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are nice and comfortable. The only issue is that I have really small hands and they are too big for me. I kept one pair and gave the rest to my mom who really likes them.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela E Aragonez

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, thick tips
customer_reviews.text: Bought these gloves for quilting - holds fabric better than bare hands. They would work well for gardening but the finger tips limited my ability to do fine pick ups.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Covid 19 grocery shopping gloves
customer_reviews.text: covid-19 shopping gloves. Grips well in store! Been through 2-3 wash cycles looking good. Nice cotton and air
customer_reviews.author: chiago city girl

customer_reviews.title: Fit snuggly
customer_reviews.text: Great colors! But fit too snugly for "one size fits all". Also, material a bit too thin-shows wear and tear too quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Love
customer_reviews.text: I am always in need of gardening gloves. I use them for everything....these fit perfectly and are so cute.
customer_reviews.author: Susan G.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Inexpensive Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Good, practical set of garden gloves. They're lightweight enough for summer and the three colors are bright and cheerful.
customer_reviews.author: pws

customer_reviews.title: Met my need
customer_reviews.text: I have large hands and have problems finding gloves to fit. This did and are very comfortable. Good value for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen S.

customer_reviews.title: Cute & comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I have small hands and these fit me. Would recommend if you have small hands too! Cute and protects your hands!
customer_reviews.author: Krista Birchfield

customer_reviews.title: Okay but everything sticks to them!
customer_reviews.text: These gardening gloves are okay however everything sticks to them which makes a little hard to trim and pick up items in the garden. They do cover my hands well so that's a good thing. For the price for 3 pairs of gloves they are okay.
customer_reviews.author: Pinky 1

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Fit well - my hands are larger for a woman so that was good. Seem durable enough. Pretty colors.
customer_reviews.author: Ami Guimond

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable Despite Size
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable gloves, and they’re easy to wash. Most times I can just clap my hands go get rid of dirt. A good washing is needed when the gloves get wet. I just wish they came in different sizes. Many people state they’re too small, but they’re too big for me. I typically wear a medium in leather gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Comfy yet durable
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves!! Our yard in our new house was so overgrown and I started getting blisters until I got these! They are super comfy yet durable!
customer_reviews.author: Ana Elsey

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price. I use this for weeding and general gardening work. They are washable. They are breathable.
customer_reviews.author: IVJ

customer_reviews.title: Thin, soft material and too big
customer_reviews.text: These fit ok in the hands, but they’re super loose around the wrists and don’t stay on very well. They’re also not very durable or thick, multiple thorns and even small sticks go through them very easily. Good for light gardening or reporting plants, but not good for weeding or any real gardening.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Cute pattern and you get three pair  in a package.
customer_reviews.text: This bronzer just what I needed and I love the fact you get three different pairs in three different colors. Perfect for the garden.
customer_reviews.author: M L in Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I wanted: lightweight, sturdy, gloves for gardening. I have also used them for painting.
customer_reviews.author: christine e thompson

customer_reviews.title: A+ item, good price too.
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality 3 pack at a good price. Seams and elastic continue to hold up thru many wash/dry cycles.
customer_reviews.author: SusanKnows

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Have several pairs I can switch between. They fit well and are easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Already have holes
customer_reviews.text: These are not very durable. First use and I had holes in the finger tips from gardening.
customer_reviews.author: C.J.

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality..not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: Horrible gloves..dollar store gloves r better than these..got holes in them after using just a few times
customer_reviews.author: Vijay

customer_reviews.title: These are by far the best garden gloves I have used as a work glove ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pair of work gloves, but my hands are too small for most gloves that are advertised as "work gloves." I usually have to use garden gloves. These are by far the best garden gloves I have used as a work glove replacement. I've used them before. They can take a beating, don't tear easily, have a great grip, they are thick enough to not worry about bug bites, and the fit makes it so I have the same mobility that large heavy duty gloves don't allow.
customer_reviews.author: T'Leah McQuade

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping dependable description
customer_reviews.text: What a pile of gloves! Always misplacing or my dog chewing one, now I always have a spare
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Joel

customer_reviews.title: would buy these again and again
customer_reviews.text: these are great and super comfortable. I used them to pull out some evergreen type ground cover/bushes and didn't get pricked once! Finally gloves that fit my hand size as well. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Laura lu

customer_reviews.title: They fit!
customer_reviews.text: It was a guess as to whether or not they would actually fit (they did!). Time will tell whether or not they are durable. They just seem like average inexpensive garden gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Betty L.

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and great quality
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely adorable for working in the garden. Can not wait to try them out soon.
customer_reviews.author: AppleGirl

customer_reviews.title: great for using in the garden
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are soft inside and sturdy outside for all the things I need them for.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves. Could be heavier.
customer_reviews.text: Nice gloves. Not sure how long they will last but they fit and are what I expected. Soft cotton gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Krewsin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, but didn’t fit my size 8 hands.  :(
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, but I read the review that said that they fit even their husbands hands. I am tall and have piano fingers I guess. I wear a ladies size 8 gloves and these did not fit me. My daughter in law will love them, though. Smaller hands.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gloves...
customer_reviews.text: I just received my order, and couldn't get to my KINDLE FIRE fast enough so I could order some more. None of the garden stores sell these simple gloves anymore. The size is perfect, but I have small hands. And the gloves are actually prettier than the picture. I am a happy gardener, thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

product_meta.title: G & F 1852-3 Women Soft Jersey Garden Gloves, Women Work Gloves, 3-Pairs Green/Pink/Blue per Pack
product_meta.description:
100-Percent Cotton soft jersey garden gloves; flower print with knot wrist to keep dirt out with PVC dots for extra grip. One size fits all.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
100-Percent cotton soft Jersey garden gloves; flower print with knot wrist to keep dirt out with pvc dots for extra Grip. One size fits all.
